overview.description: Conozca sus derechos al interactuar con ICE.

public.title: Si ICE lo detiene en público
public.description: Qué hacer si ICE lo detiene en un espacio público.

car.title: Si ICE lo detiene en su auto
car.description: Sus derechos durante una parada de tráfico por ICE.

home.title: Si ICE llega a su casa
home.description: Cómo manejar a los agentes de ICE en su puerta.

work.title: Si ICE llega a su trabajo
work.description: Sus derechos si ICE realiza una redada o visita su lugar de trabajo.

documents.title: Documentos para llevar consigo
documents.description: Documentos esenciales para llevar en todo momento.

hero.title: [SPANISH] Know Your Rights. Protect Your Community.
hero.description: [SPANISH] Immigration enforcement and police are used to divide and intimidate the working class. Know your rights, prepare your family, and stand together so no one faces ICE or the courts alone. This is how we fight back.

emergency.title: [SPANISH] Emergency & Preparation
emergency.subtitle: [SPANISH] I need to know my rights or prepare my family.

support.title: [SPANISH] Request Support
support.subtitle: [SPANISH] I have an ICE check-in or court date.

involved.title: [SPANISH] Get Involved
involved.subtitle: [SPANISH] I want to volunteer or stand with immigrants.

kyr_home.disclaimer: [SPANISH] Disclaimer: These materials are for information only, not legal advice. Always consult a trusted attorney or legal worker about your specific situation.

sections.rights_prep_title: [SPANISH] Know Your Rights & Prepare Your Family
sections.rights_prep_intro: [SPANISH] The most important tools you have are the right to remain silent and the right to not consent to searches. Memorize them. Teach them to your family. The guides below provide step-by-step instructions for what to do in common situations.

emergency_box.text: [SPANISH] If someone has already been detained or is being detained right now, call the VWN hotline immediately at {phone} and read our {link}.

get_involved_section.title: [SPANISH] From Knowledge to Action: Stand with the Working Class
get_involved_section.intro: [SPANISH] Knowing your rights is the first step. The next is acting collectively. The bosses and landlords use immigration status to keep wages low and crush organizing for everyone. When we stand together, we make it harder for them to operate in silence and fear. This is how we build power.

subsection_a.title: [SPANISH] Direct Support & Community Defense
subsection_a.copy: [SPANISH] We organize volunteer teams to observe ICE check-ins and accompany people to high-risk appointments. Our presence provides community protection, documents state activity, and ensures no one disappears alone. This is not charity; it is disciplined, working-class solidarity.

button_1.text: [SPANISH] Sign up for an ICE Check-In Coverage shift
button_1.subtext: [SPANISH] Observe and log activity outside the Stockton ICE facility.

button_2.subtext: [SPANISH] Support people at check-ins, court dates, and other appointments.

button_3.subtext: [SPANISH] Spread information by canvassing, tabling, and giving presentations to your family or congregation.

subsection_b.title: [SPANISH] Political Commitment
subsection_b.h3: [SPANISH] Build a United Front of the Working Class
subsection_b.copy: [SPANISH] We are building a united front of workers in San Joaquin County—farmworkers, tenants, congregations, and union members—independent of both major parties. We will not be divided by papers, race, or language. We will organize where we live and work until no employer can threaten a worker into silence and no family faces these crises alone.

button_1.text: [SPANISH] Read & Sign the United Front Letter
button_1.subtext: [SPANISH] Show that San Joaquin's working class stands with our immigrant neighbors.

button_2.subtext: [SPANISH] Become a member of a democratic, fighting organization.

request_support.title: [SPANISH] Support for Your ICE Check-In or Appointment
request_support.intro: [SPANISH] You do not have to face this alone. If you have an upcoming ICE check-in or other high-risk appointment, you can securely share your information with us. We will do our best to support you.

section1.title: [SPANISH] How We Can Help
section1.p1: [SPANISH] We are volunteers, not lawyers. We keep your information confidential and only share it with trusted members of our team who are directly involved in your support. We will never share your details with ICE, police, or your employer.
section1.p2: [SPANISH] Based on your request and our volunteer availability, we can try to:
list: [SPANISH] Organize volunteers outside the building during your appointment time.
[SPANISH] Call or text you before your appointment to check in.
[SPANISH] Call or text you after your appointment to confirm you are safe.
[SPANISH] Contact your emergency person and community hotlines if we believe you may have been detained.

form.title: [SPANISH] Confidential Support Request
form.intro: [SPANISH] Please fill out the form below. The more information you provide, the better we can prepare to support you.

next_steps.title: [SPANISH] What Happens Next
steps: [SPANISH] A trusted WCU coordinator will review your request.
[SPANISH] We will contact you via your safe phone number to confirm we received your information and let you know what support we can realistically provide.
[SPANISH] We prioritize higher-risk cases and will always be honest about our volunteer capacity. We cannot guarantee someone will be present in person, but we will always do our best.

emergency.text: [SPANISH] If someone has already been detained or is being detained right now, do not use this form. Go to our {link} or call the VWN hotline immediately at {phone}.

about_page.title: They Have Their Parties. We Need Our Own Organization
about_page.p1: The bosses and landlords have two political parties. The working class needs a fighting organization of its own.
about_page.p2: Across San Joaquin, rents rise while our wages stall. Bosses demand more while giving less. Both the Democratic and Republican parties answer to their donors, not to us.
about_page.p3: Our political and economic system is not broken; it is working exactly as designed to protect the profits of the wealthy by keeping the rest of us divided and powerless. It makes us too poor to live in and own the homes we’ve built, too poor to eat the food we’ve grown and served, too poor to benefit from the fruits of our labor.
about_page.p4: We refuse to accept this. We are organizing a mass working-class movement to build the genuine democracy we deserve – one where working people have real control over our lives, our communities, and our economy. We are not a political party. We organize collectively through mass membership. We do not have to continue relying on politicians, lobbying them, and hoping that they side with us over their donors.
about_page.p5: Working Class Unity is just as the name suggests, an organization fighting to unite the working class, to give individuals in San Joaquin control over their lives. We demand truly affordable and safe housing, workplace autonomy, protection of our communities from police oppression, and accountability from our elected officials. Our mission is to strengthen working class power by forging alliances between labor and tenant unions and social movements through education, advocacy, and direct action.
about_page.p6: We fight for our families. For the future prosperity of our children. Whatever your race, your creed, your birthplace - don’t stand by and let the wealthy tear down this country that each one of us has helped build.
about_page.p7: Together, we can build a member-run movement in San Joaquin County that wins concrete victories, without the compromises and betrayals of politicians and their wealthy donors.

hero.title: collective, class-conscious power
hero.description: If you believe in mass organizing over fighting alone, in democracy over monied interests, and in building class-consciousness over supporting the status quo, you are already one of us. There is a war being waged against the working class. Join us and fight back.

rank_and_file.title: Membership
rank_and_file.description: Become a rank and file member.

solidarity.title: Solidarity
solidarity.description: Become a rank and file member. Paying more does not get you additional benefits, but it does let us print more flyers.

donate.title: Donate - One Time
donate.description: If you cannot become a member but still want to support WCU, you can make a one time donation.

benefits.title: Rank and File Membership
benefits.description: Joining Working Class Unity means actively shaping the organization's direction, taking responsibility for actions, and engaging in our campaigns.

voting.title: Voting Rights
voting.description: Members participate in all decision-making processes and determine the direction of our organization.

leadership.title: Leadership
leadership.description: All members are eligible to hold any office or serve on any committee within our organization.

campaigns.title: Campaigns
campaigns.description: Our campaigns primarily aim to advance socialism and build power for the working class.

education.title: Education
education.description: Members work together to produce political educational material & organizing skill trainings.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Frequently Asked Questions About Membership and Participation

eligibility.question: What are the eligibility requirements to become a member of Working Class Unity?
eligibility.answer: To be eligible for membership in WCU, individuals must be in good standing and either reside, work, or attend school or church in San Joaquin County, California.

good_standing.question: What does it mean to be a member in good standing?
good_standing.answer: Members in good standing have paid their dues (with a 30-day grace period), attended at least one regular meeting per year, adhered to WCU’s values and mission, and have not engaged in behavior that violates WCU’s Code of Conduct.

dues.question: Why do you have membership dues?
dues.answer: WCU is fully funded by Member dues and donations. By not taking large donor or government grants, we are able to focus solely on our mission and the interests of the working class without external influence.

contact.question: ¿Puedo hablar con alguien antes de unirme?
contact.answer: ¡Sí, por supuesto! Puedes programar una llamada rápida con un miembro del Comité Directivo {link}.

hero.title: We will not abandon our neighbors.
hero.subtitle: Independent Check-In Monitoring & Accompaniment
hero.description: The system relies on people being alone. We rely on solidarity. We need people at the local ICE facility to ensure no one disappears in silence.
hero.appointment_help_text: Click here if you need someone to watch out for you.

orientation.heading: Onboarding Video
orientation.caption: Watch: How we monitor, how we log, and how we stay safe.

schedule.heading: Claim Your Shift
schedule.arrival: Arrival: You must arrive 15 minutes early to to get a clipboard and get a briefing from the previous volunteer.
schedule.role: Role: You are an observer. You log arrivals/departures and provide resources.
schedule.calendar_refresh_note: Por favor actualice la página si no ve el calendario a continuación.

notice.text: Las tácticas de detención de emergencia cambian. Antes de cada turno, abra esta página para ver las instrucciones actuales sobre qué hacer si alguien es detenido.

descriptions.check_in_sheet: Un formulario para las personas que llegan a su cita de presentación.
descriptions.tracker_log: Un formulario para que los voluntarios registren las llegadas y salidas.
descriptions.quick_guide: Una guía de referencia rápida para los voluntarios en turno.
descriptions.if_detained: Guía de recursos de emergencia si alguien es detenido.

end_of_shift.heading: AFTER YOUR SHIFT
end_of_shift.copy: Your shift isn't over until the data is safe.

debrief.title: 1. The Debrief
debrief.description: Tell us how it went. How many safe check-ins? Did you see ICE agents? How did you feel? You'll receive a link via email/SMS.

logs.title: 2. The Logs (Security Protocol)
logs.drop_off: DROP OFF the physical sheets at the WCU Office Mail Slot:

contact.heading: APOYO DEL ORGANIZADOR
contact.description: ¿No está seguro del protocolo? Hable con un organizador.

public_areas.title: [SPANISH] Public areas (no permission needed):
public_areas.description: [SPANISH] Lobbies, dining rooms, and retail spaces. Entry alone does not grant authority to stop, question, or arrest anyone.

private_areas.title: [SPANISH] Private areas (permission required):
private_areas.description: [SPANISH] ICE needs a judicial warrant signed by a judge—not a DHS order. If an employee or employer consents, ICE can enter without a warrant.

rights_at_work.title: [SPANISH] Your rights at work
list: [SPANISH] Remain silent.
[SPANISH] Refuse searches.
[SPANISH] Refuse to show documentation or ID.
[SPANISH] Stand together in the center of the room. Refuse to separate by immigration status. ICE uses this tactic to isolate individuals—protect each other.

hero.subtitle: [SPANISH] Caution
hero.description: [SPANISH] Understand your rights when ICE appears at your workplace. Know where they can and cannot go.

approaches.title: [SPANISH] If ICE Approaches You
do_not_list: [SPANISH] Run, resist, or lie about your identity
[SPANISH] Sign any documents without an attorney
do_list: [SPANISH] Stay calm and remember your rights
[SPANISH] Ask if you are free to leave
approaches.say_this_text: [SPANISH] "I wish to remain silent. I do not consent to a search. Am I free to go?"

employer.title: [SPANISH] Employer Responsibilities
employer.intro: [SPANISH] Your employer has rights and responsibilities during an ICE visit:

warrant.title: [SPANISH] Ask for Warrant
warrant.desc: [SPANISH] Can request to see a valid judicial warrant

deny.title: [SPANISH] Deny Access
deny.desc: [SPANISH] Can refuse entry to non-public areas without warrant

attorney.title: [SPANISH] Call Attorney
attorney.desc: [SPANISH] Can contact company lawyer before cooperating

notify.title: [SPANISH] Notify Workers
notify.desc: [SPANISH] Can inform employees of their rights

header.title: [SPANISH] Documents to Keep
header.description: [SPANISH] Know which documents to carry, when to show them, and how to protect your rights based on your immigration status.

safety.title: [SPANISH] Document Safety
list: [SPANISH] Make copies of everything. Store originals with trusted family or friends.
[SPANISH] Never show foreign documents (passports, birth certificates) that reveal birthplace outside the U.S. These can trigger deportation.

legal_status.title: [SPANISH] If You Have Legal Status
legal_status.includes_text: [SPANISH] Green card, asylum, refugee status, valid student visa, or TPS.
carry_list: [SPANISH] Your lawful resident card or immigration papers
show_list: [SPANISH] Present these documents if law enforcement requests them

pending_status.title: [SPANISH] If You Have Pending Status
pending_status.includes_text: [SPANISH] Pending asylum application, open immigration court case, or immigration appeal.
carry_list: [SPANISH] Copies of papers proving you applied for status or filed an appeal
show_list: [SPANISH] Present these documents only if arrested

undocumented.title: [SPANISH] If Undocumented or Expired
undocumented.carry_label: [SPANISH] Carry proof of U.S. residence for 2+ years
carry_list: [SPANISH] Documents showing your name, U.S. address, and date
undocumented.callout_text: [SPANISH] These documents can prevent expedited removal without a hearing. Without proof of 2+ years residence, you can face deportation without seeing a judge.

legal.carry: [SPANISH] Lawful resident card or immigration papers

remember.title: [SPANISH] Remember
remember.text: [SPANISH] "I wish to remain silent. I do not consent to any searches."

header.title: SI LA POLICÍA DE INMIGRACIÓN Y ADUANAS (ICE) LLEGA A SU HOGAR
header.subtitle: Siga estos pasos inmediatamente si lo abordan en su casa.

do_not_consent.title: No consienta que registren
do_not_consent.do_not: NO: Abra la puerta ni salga afuera.
do_not_consent.do: SÍ: Grabe el encuentro desde dentro de su hogar.

ask_id.title: PIDA POR IDENTIFICACIÓN
list: Pida los números de placa y sus nombres.
Grabe o anote esta información.

warrant.title: EXIJA QUE PRESENTEN LA ORDEN JUDICIAL

no_warrant.title: Si afirman no tener una orden judicial o si ve que no tiene la firma de un juez:
list: Diga: «Ejerzo mi derecho a permanecer en silencio».
Diga: «No pueden entrar sin mi consentimiento».
Mantenga la puerta cerrada.

has_warrant.title: Si afirman tener una orden judicial:
list: Pídales que la deslicen por debajo de la puerta o que la muestren por la ventana.
Saque foto de la orden judicial.

check_items.title: Compruebe estos cuatro puntos:
list: Autoridad emisora: Debe ser un TRIBUNAL, no el Departamento de Seguridad Nacional ni el ICE
Identidad del sujeto: Deben aparecer su nombre y dirección correcta, no los de otra persona
Fecha de caducidad: La fecha de «ejecución» debe ser dentro de los 14 días
Firma: Debe tener firma de un juez o magistrado, no por un funcionario de inmigración

if_enters.title: Si la orden judicial pasa los cuatro puntos
list: Cuando sólo aparezca su nombre en la orden: Salga solo y cierre la puerta detrás de usted
Cuando la orden también incluya el registro de domicilio: Siga grabando. Los agentes deben proporcionar recibos por cualquier propiedad incautada
Para cualquier orden judicial válida: No diga nada. No firme nada. No mienta. Proporcione los documentos solo cuando se le soliciten. Pida por un abogado.

invalid_warrant.title: Si la orden judicial no pasa algún punto:
list: Diga: «Ejerzo mi derecho a permanecer en silencio. No pueden entrar».
Mantenga la puerta cerrada.

hero.description: [SPANISH] Stay calm, know your rights, and protect yourself during a traffic stop.

always_pull_over.title: [SPANISH] Always pull over
always_pull_over.content: [SPANISH] Pull over when any law enforcement signals you to stop, even if you do not think you did anything wrong.
always_pull_over.recording_tip: [SPANISH] Start recording. If alone, place the phone in a cup holder or pocket while recording continues.

warning.title: [SPANISH] Warning
warning.content: [SPANISH] ICE uses unmarked vehicles and may wear plain clothes or vests labeled “POLICE” without identifying themselves as immigration.

window.title: [SPANISH] Your window
window.content: [SPANISH] Roll down your window slightly when asked.

providing_info.title: [SPANISH] Providing information

drivers.title: [SPANISH] Drivers must provide:
list: [SPANISH] Driver’s license.
[SPANISH] Registration and proof of insurance.

passengers.title: [SPANISH] Passengers
list: [SPANISH] Cannot be forced to show ID.
[SPANISH] Cannot be forced to give name, address, legal status or place of birth.

advice: [SPANISH] Request officer identification before presenting any documents.
[SPANISH] Do not lie or give false documents.

all_occupants.title: [SPANISH] For all occupants:
list: [SPANISH] Decline to discuss immigration status or criminal history.
all_occupants.say: [SPANISH] Am I free to go? I do not consent to provide ID or answer questions.

exiting.title: [SPANISH] Exiting the vehicle
exiting.content: [SPANISH] Officer may order you to get out for “officer safety.” This order often precedes arrest.
exiting.warning: [SPANISH] Officers may force removal if you delay.

search_limitations.title: [SPANISH] Search limitations
search_limitations.content: [SPANISH] ICE needs a judicial warrant or your consent to search:
list: [SPANISH] Your body (beyond a pat-down).
[SPANISH] The inside of your vehicle.
[SPANISH] Glove compartment or trunk.
search_limitations.say: [SPANISH] I do not consent to any searches.
search_limitations.repeat: [SPANISH] Repeat this even if officers proceed anyway.

fingerprints.title: [SPANISH] Fingerprint collection

when.title: [SPANISH] ICE can take fingerprints only when:
list: [SPANISH] Officers suspect immigration violations.
[SPANISH] You are under arrest.

if_requested.title: [SPANISH] If requested without a clear cause:
list: [SPANISH] Ask: “Why am I being fingerprinted?”
[SPANISH] Say: “I do not consent to fingerprinting.”

fingerprints.resistance: [SPANISH] Do not physically resist. Verbal objection may protect your legal rights.

tactics.title: [SPANISH] ICE Tactics
list: [SPANISH] Follow you near your home or in public spaces.
[SPANISH] Wear plain clothes without identifying themselves.
[SPANISH] Call out your name to confirm your identity.

stopped.title: [SPANISH] If stopped by ICE
stopped.silent: [SPANISH] Stay silent. Do not state your name or answer questions.

if_yes.title: [SPANISH] If they say YES:
steps: [SPANISH] Walk away calmly if they let you.

if_no.title: [SPANISH] If they say NO:
steps: [SPANISH] SAY: “I will not answer questions. I want a lawyer.”
[SPANISH] Do not lie, show false documents, or run.

protect.title: [SPANISH] Protect Yourself
list: [SPANISH] Record the encounter or ask someone to record. Remember that anything you say in that recording can be used against you, so stick to repeating your rights.
[SPANISH] When requesting help, avoid saying your name. Give them a contact's name to send the video.
[SPANISH] Carry an emergency card with your lawyer's and family’s contact information.
[SPANISH] If searched without consent: Say, “I do not consent to this search. I want a lawyer.”

unitedfront.title: Un Frente Unido de la Clase Obrera: El Condado de San Joaquín se une en contra de la Persecución de Inmigrantes y la Intimidación contra los Trabajadores
unitedfront.subtitle: Quieren que tengamos miedo y que estemos divididos.

whatWeFace.heading: A QUÉ NOS ENFRENTAMOS
whatWeFace.content: En todo el país, la vigilancia policial y de inmigración alteran la vida cotidiana en nuestros barrios, escuelas, centros de trabajo e iglesias. Nuestros compañeros de trabajo y vecinos están siendo interrogados y detenidos sin consideración por la justicia o el proceso debido. Aunque no estamos presenciando el mismo nivel de actividad que en Chicago y Los Ángeles, no debemos permitir que eso nos haga sentir confiados.

whoWeAre.heading: QUIÉNES SOMOS
whoWeAre.content: Somos comités de trabajadores agrícolas, sindicatos de inquilinos, congregaciones religiosas y sindicalistas del Condado de San Joaquín. Nuestro compromiso es simple: este es nuestro Valle Central, protegeremos unos a otros y actuaremos unidos.

ourPrinciples.heading: NUESTROS PRINCIPIOS
ourPrinciples.content1: Nos organizamos para evitar que el miedo divida a la clase obrera. Pelear entre nosotros por migajas para cubrir los costos de la atención médica, la vivienda y la supervivencia siempre ha sido un juego de tontos. El lema del movimiento laboral, "un daño a uno es un daño a todos", sigue siendo cierto. Entendemos que cuando los trabajadores inmigrantes son atacados, los salarios, el bienestar y el poder de cada trabajador se debilitan.
ourPrinciples.content2: La respuesta no es dejarnos llevar por el pánico. Al contrario, debemos organizarnos y luchar de manera disciplinada. Nuestra ira, indignación y compasión deben transformarse en acciones de organización y solidaridad deliberadas y a largo plazo.
ourPrinciples.content3: Nos expresamos en el lenguaje de clase. Ningún patrón o funcionario debería poder usar el estatus migratorio para callar a los trabajadores, robar salarios, desalojar familias o debilitar a los sindicatos. La fuerza de los inmigrantes forma parte de la fuerza de toda la clase obrera estadounidense.

unitedFront.heading: UN FRENTE UNIDO
unitedFront.content: Un frente unido reúne a organizaciones de la clase obrera en base a objetivos compartidos. Es independiente de los dos partidos políticos principales y de las instituciones de la clase capitalista. Este no es un frente popular que nos subordina al programa o a los candidatos del Partido Demócrata. Cooperamos con aquellos que respeten nuestra independencia y el liderazgo de las organizaciones de la clase obrera.

whyStandTogether.heading: POR QUÉ DEBEMOS UNIRNOS
whyStandTogether.content: Las grandes corporaciones, y sus aliados en el gobierno, imponen la explotación y la guerra en el extranjero, obligando a millones a migrar para sobrevivir. La misma clase dominante luego culpa a los inmigrantes por las crisis causadas por la codicia corporativa, con la esperanza de fracturar a la clase obrera y mantener los salarios bajos. Cuando se les infunde a los trabajadores indocumentados con miedo, los patrones pueden amenazar con la deportación para aplastar los esfuerzos de organización y bajar los salarios. Eso perjudica a toda la clase obrera. La respuesta no es atacar entre nosotros; la respuesta es unirnos y luchar juntos contra los patrones.

whyNeitherParty.heading: POR QUÉ NI LOS DEMÓCRATAS NI LOS REPUBLICANOS TE SALVARÁN
whyNeitherParty.content: Ambos partidos responden al gran capital. Los republicanos hacen campaña con ataques abiertos contra los inmigrantes y los sindicatos. Los demócratas ofrecen palabras más amables, pero han presidido deportaciones masivas y aumentado el control migratorio, mientras dejan que las ciudades de clase obrera carguen con los costos de la migración sin ningún apoyo. El resultado es predecible: la gente que ya tiene dificultades con la vivienda y los servicios es puesta a competir contra los recién llegados por recursos por los que ningún grupo debería tener que pelear. Rechazamos la propaganda de que nuestras únicas opciones son la crueldad de un partido o las promesas vacías del otro. Construimos un poder independiente y organizado por la clase obrera.

notSlogans.heading: NO SOLO CONSIGNAS: ORGANIZACIÓN Y PERSUASIÓN
notSlogans.content: La lucha inmigrante no puede limitarse a consignas virales, como si las palabras por sí solas pudieran cambiar la realidad. Los estallidos de energía deben convertirse en una organización paciente y disciplinada, arraigada en los centros de trabajo, los barrios, las escuelas y las congregaciones. Debemos explicar nuestra situación con claridad, hacer el trabajo duro y persuadir.

longTermDemands.heading: NUESTRAS EXIGENCIAS A LARGO PLAZO
longTermDemands.intro: Luchamos para defender el Condado de San Joaquín, y un país, donde cada trabajador pueda vivir y trabajar con dignidad, seguridad e igualdad de derechos.
longTermDemands.demand1: El respeto al proceso debido y los derechos civiles
longTermDemands.demand2: Libertad de expresión y de asociación
longTermDemands.demand3: El cumplimiento real de los derechos laborales para todos los trabajadores, sin importar su estatus migratorio
longTermDemands.demand4: Ciudadanía para todos que ya están aquí y caminos reales hacia la ciudadanía para los futuros inmigrantes

pledge.heading: NUESTRO COMPROMISO
pledge.content: No abandonaremos a nuestros vecinos. No nos dejaremos dividir por papeles, raza, idioma, partido o código postal. Construiremos un frente unido de trabajadores en el Condado de San Joaquín, independiente de los políticos y las corporaciones que lucran con nuestro miedo. Nos organizaremos donde vivimos, trabajamos y nos congregamos, hasta que ningún patrón pueda amenazar a un trabajador para silenciarlo y ninguna familia enfrente estas crisis sola. Únase a nosotros hoy.

solidarity.heading: Agregue su nombre en solidaridad
solidarity.formPlaceholder: El formulario de FormBuilder aparecerá aquí

campaigns.pageSubtitle: Mira en qué estamos trabajando y cómo puedes participar
campaigns.noResults: Ninguna campaña coincide con tu filtro actual

tenetUnion.title: Trabajo Sindical de Tenet
tenetUnion.description: Apoyando a los trabajadores de la salud en su lucha por salarios justos y mejores condiciones laborales en los hospitales Tenet en todo el Valle Central.

ceasefirePalestine.title: Alto al Fuego en Palestina
ceasefirePalestine.description: Abogando por un cese al fuego inmediato y acceso a ayuda humanitaria en Gaza. En solidaridad con los civiles palestinos.

medicareForAll.title: Medicare para Todos
medicareForAll.description: Construyendo apoyo popular para un sistema de salud universal de pagador único. Todos merecen atención médica de calidad sin importar sus ingresos.

knowYourRightsWorkshops.title: Talleres Conozca Sus Derechos
knowYourRightsWorkshops.description: Talleres educativos que ayudan a los miembros de la comunidad a entender sus derechos constitucionales al interactuar con la policía e ICE.

communityCanvassing.title: Difusión Comunitaria
communityCanvassing.description: Alcance puerta a puerta para conectar con los vecinos, compartir recursos y construir poder de la clase trabajadora en nuestras comunidades.

fundraiserDrive.title: Campaña de Recaudación
fundraiserDrive.description: Nuestra campaña anual de recaudación de fondos para apoyar los esfuerzos de organización y programas comunitarios durante todo el año.

hero.title: Próximos Eventos
hero.description: Únete a nuestros eventos comunitarios, talleres y acciones. Filtra por tipo para encontrar eventos que te interesen.

calendar.no_events: No se encontraron eventos que coincidan con tu filtro.

event1.title: Reunión General de Miembros
event1.description: Reunión mensual de miembros generales para discutir campañas en curso y actualizaciones organizacionales.

event2.title: Taller de Derechos de Inquilinos
event2.description: Aprende sobre tus derechos como inquilino y cómo protegerte de desalojos ilegales.

event3.title: Día de Acción por Palestina
event3.description: Únete a nosotros para un día de acciones de solidaridad pidiendo un alto al fuego inmediato.

event4.title: Difusión Comunitaria - Tower District
event4.description: Alcance puerta a puerta en el Tower District para conectar con miembros de la comunidad.

event5.title: Orientación para Nuevos Miembros
event5.description: Orientación virtual para nuevos miembros para aprender sobre la misión, estructura y cómo involucrarse con WCU.

event6.title: Foro de Derechos de Salud
event6.description: Foro comunitario discutiendo Medicare para Todos y acceso a la salud en el Valle Central.
